title: Sampler (England), 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen, silk  
Technique: reticella, withdrawn element work, running back-stitch embroidery
provenance:
(MJL No. 33, CG no. 73);  2002 appraisal #57
"Mrs. Redmond Cross found this sampler & bought it for me May 1924 for [?] from the Royal School of Needlework.  They passed on it as unusually good in my way linen folded near top-- JP Fraser"
creditline: Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers
description: Long sampler with bands of reticella work based on a grid of withdrawn elements; one embroidered band in running back stitch in blue and green (not completed).  The linen is doubled back on either side of the embroidered band.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler (England), 17th century. Medium: linen, silk  
Technique: reticella, withdrawn element work, running back-stitch embroidery. 
Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers. 2003-14-18.
